text: I'm working on an experimental package that may ultimately be absorbed into another package. Is that a good reason to not register it? Are outdated packages ever removed from the registry? I'd like to avoid potentially confusing users if there are two packages with similar names but one is discontinued.

elements.text: I'm working on an experimental package that may ultimately be absorbed into another package. Is that a good reason to not register it? Are outdated packages ever removed from the registry? I'd like to avoid potentially confusing users if there are two packages with similar names but one is discontinued.

text:
While things are never and will never (exceptions aside) be deleted from registry at some point we might have the option to `unlist` them s that they don’t tab-complete, and maybe don’t block the name from being used for something else, and maybe show a warning on install.

<https://github.com/JuliaLang/Pkg.jl/issues/2194>

root.text: I'm working on an experimental package that may ultimately be absorbed into another package. Is that a good reason to not register it? Are outdated packages ever removed from the registry? I'd like to avoid potentially confusing users if there are two packages with similar names but one is discontinued.

elements.text: I'm working on an experimental package that may ultimately be absorbed into another package. Is that a good reason to not register it? Are outdated packages ever removed from the registry? I'd like to avoid potentially confusing users if there are two packages with similar names but one is discontinued.
While things are never and will never (exceptions aside) be deleted from registry at some point we might have the option to
them s that they don’t tab-complete, and maybe don’t block the name from being used for something else, and maybe show a warning on install.

text: I think yanking all versions would have the same effect?  (just annoying to yank every single version)

elements.text: I think yanking all versions would have the same effect?  (just annoying to yank every single version)

text: Something like this would be great, especially as the ecosystem grows. I absolutely avoid registering packages because I don't want to take up the name when I may not use it in the end or end up moving the code into another package. And the benefits to registering are many, so this waiting is not ideal.

elements.text: Something like this would be great, especially as the ecosystem grows. I absolutely avoid registering packages because I don't want to take up the name when I may not use it in the end or end up moving the code into another package. And the benefits to registering are many, so this waiting is not ideal.

text: I don't think any solution would be backward compatible though (`yank` doesn't work for julia v1.0-1.1 for example)

elements.text: I don't think any solution would be backward compatible though (
doesn't work for julia v1.0-1.1 for example)
